vyābāheti：[vi-ā-bah の caus．] 追出す，拒斥す．aor．vyābāhiṃsu [=vyābādhiṃsu＜vyābādheti の aor．]．

Vyābāheti，[vi+ā+bah： see bahati3] lit．“to make an outsider，” to keep or to be kept out or away Vin．II，140 （°bāhiṁsu in Pass．sense； so that they may not be kept away）．Oldenberg （on p．320） suggests reading vyābādhiṁsu，which may be better，viz．“may not be offended” （?）．The form is difficult to explain．（Page 654）
